38843442.review:
When I play this game, I feel a different aura when compared to different bullet hells.

It's potentially due to the combination of soothing music, beautiful backgrounds, and trance-inducing bullet patterns that seem to calm me down with this game, even if I die a lot. 

This game's story is simple to understand and is not very watered down for the viewer, so with that said, Mushihimesama really pulls through with every element that it tries to deliver to the player. My anxiety is severely reduced while playing this, which is ironic due to it being a bullet hell game. Maybe CAVE is really that good? 

The difficulty level is standard. I personally recommend using a controller with this game and playing it in fullscreen at night, though it is your choice, of course. Please enjoy this game in short, enjoyable bursts whenever you feel the need.

38124548.review:
炎热暑假的午后，没有空调，只有几架电扇拼命摇头，努力吹散弥漫的汗味。

在前几关的积累后， 屏幕下方一排清屏炸弹，上方一列额外生命。最终 BOSS 在前方缓缓展开自己的机体，终战即将到来。

眼睛一眨不眨，瞳仁不断反射着屏幕上的光芒。机台前的凳子被踢到了一边。右臂的肌肉紧绷，抽搐般竭力按着 A 键，左腕灵活翻动，前拉后打着一根红头铁杆。

肾上腺素飙升，呼吸加深，瞳孔缩小，双腿如桩，面目狰狞。四周观众密围，但默契地留出机前半方空地，鸦雀无声。

BOSS 机甲尽褪，真身显露，巨大阴谋缓缓屏开，如潮弹幕八方涌来。

前线已然崩溃，双手颤抖，双腿战栗，咬牙切齿，冷汗盈眉。弹药已尽，左上尚余八命，一命三炸，已然以命相搏。

又不过眨眼之间，最后一命，炸皆尽，弹尽粮绝，苦苦强撑。

一世积累，尽殁此役。黑幕从屏内弥散到屏外，心智殚竭，不见曙光。

屏上忽然火花四溅，四周观众齐声欢呼，你尚不知道发生何事。

八月如火，然而手脚冰凉。

许久，轻舒一口气，吐出一字：

“爽”。

功成名就，一币三毛。

[h1]江湖虽已远，君莫忘少年。[/h1]

36444619.review:
Mushihimesama is the first game on Steam that I've enjoyed enough to write a review for.

It is very pretty, with visuals and concept designs really setting a fairytale theme that a lot of shmups can't do nearly as well.

The controls are really enjoyable and easy to get used to on keyboard (for me).

Arrange mode has amazing music and gameplay without coming anywhere near to being overwhelming.

The story builds a nice world with little dialogue forcing a fantasy concept into your head, unlike most other fantasy style games (this means it makes a pretty world for its story and gameplay to take place in without you having to read text to explain the game's setting and its characters).

I really like this game. Please buy it.

33509131.review:
Uno de los mejores (y más difíciles) "Bullet Hell" de todos los tiempos, sin duda alguna estamos ante una obra de culto que su nombre debería al menos sonarnos y referenciarlo con jugadores asiáticos de niveles estratosféricos.

El estilo visual es muy bueno, el juego es del 2004 y luce bonito a día de hoy, así que puedo concluir que no le afecta el envejecimiento. A nivel de gameplay recordemos que estamos ante un juego arcade, así que podéis esperar que cada partida sea corta, de unos 20-25 minutos dependiendo del modo escogido (¡hay muchísimas opciones para jugar de la manera que nos sea más cómoda y agradable!). Mientras juguemos estaremos acompañados de una banda sonora bastante dinámica que le da mucha vida al juego, me encanta el apartado sonoro y tengo 0 quejas con él.

La dificultad es un aspecto que quiero criticar en el buen sentido, porque a pesar de los vídeos que rulan por "Yutubi" donde se muestra la pantalla completamente morada (y el morado es el color de las balas para que destaquen sin problemas respecto cualquier otro elemento visible), tiene dificultades bastante asequibles. Esta versión incluye el modo "Novice", donde incluso el modo Ultra es hasta "asequible" para una persona humana y medianamente hábil.

Mi problema viene con el jefe secreto cuando estamos tratando en dificultad Ultra (sin contar el modo Novice previamente mencionado), lo que viene siendo el logro más chungo del juego. Al ser un juego arcade, una de las gracias es imaginarse ser un crío delante de una máquina recreativa y únicamente tener una moneda con la que pasárselo entero sin que salte el mensaje de "Introducir moneda para continuar". La cosa es, su último ataque es tan mortal que únicamente una persona, después de 13 años de que saliera por primera vez a la luz Mushihimesama, logró esquivarlo entero sin perder siquiera UNA VIDA. Si usas una bomba o mueres, activará un escudo que impedirá que le dañes y devolverá cientos de balas si le intentas disparar. Después de muchísimos intentos he logrado llegar a esta última fase sin perder ni una vida, pero una vez llegados ahí da igual lo que haga, no logro ni hacerle cosquillas a nada de matarlo, y da rabia que un juego tan espectacular tenga un jefe tan injusto y con un patrón casi sin definir...

Resumen: Si te gustan los juegos de tiros y/o quieres iniciarte a ellos, Mushihimesama no te fallará, cada partida es una experiencia nueva y para darle caña de tanto en tanto es divertido.
8/10

33497703.review:
I've played or watched others played several bullet hell games, this Mushihimesama is most likely to be the one I will master. Although the quantity of bullets can be scary in this game, there are some advantages that have favored me. For instance, the usual velocity of bullets is relatively slow comparing to that in other bullet hell games like Ikaruga or Raiden series, giving me longer reaction time to maneuver; and all the bullets are in the same color(purple), so they are easier to distinguish from enemies themselves and backgrounds. When an enemy perishes in this game, it creates an explosion that cancels bullets around it, unlike that in Ikaruga where the enemy's demise triggers the generation of more bullets instead. The most important thing is, it doesn't have a single one of those spawn-anywhere enemies, especially those that can appears at the bottom of your screen. Because of this, no one is able to backstab you unless you voluntarily go somewhere too close to the top end.

在我玩过或看别人玩过的弹幕游戏里，《虫姬》是我最有可能玩得溜的。虽然《虫姬》里同屏子弹可能多得吓人，但这游戏对我有利的特性也不少。比如它里面的子弹速度相对比较慢（《斑鸠》的比较快，《雷电》系列的更快），而且还全是紫色的，玩家（我）既能很容易地分辨弹幕，又有相对较长的反应时间去规划路线与躲避。《虫姬》里敌机被消灭时会造成小范围爆炸，这种爆炸能将它附近一定范围内的弹幕无效化，不像《斑鸠》里敌机死亡反而会射出更多子弹。最重要的是，《虫姬》里没有那些会在刁钻位置生成的敌机，一个都没有，尤其是在屏幕底部出击的那种。只要你不自己跑到过于靠近屏幕上端的位置，你就不用担心被敌人背后捅刀。

33326496.review:
I rate the game Mushihimesama 3.5/5. Pretty good though the menus can take a little while to figure out.

This is another pretty good though fairly odd Japanese schmup game. In this one, some magical girl is apparently trying to keep garden pests out of her huge garden while searching to find her boyfriend at the center of the forest on her property i guess. She eradicates the garden pests by flying through the air on a giant beetle and shooting the garden pests with magical laser beams (the best way really). The game's ending is a bit sad though (her boyfriend dies). Of course I'm probably getting things wrong here and there because I don't speak or read Japanese.

The technical aspects of this game (controls, graphics, sound, etc.) are all pretty good except for the boring sound and overly frenetic yet still not catchy music. The ground scrolls by quite slowly so there is less excitement or sense of speed than there could have been also. The main menu gives you access to slightly different versions of the game each of which has slightly different options and some different versions of the music (and it is this game-type menu layered over the sub main menu which makes the menu system most confusing).

Depending on what game mode you use, this game can be either fairly easy or extremely difficult, thus dramatically increasing the game's replayability. The weapons you use in any mode have interesting effects also. Particularly, if you fire continuously time slows down but then your character also loses some ability to maneuver well but tapping the fire button quickly results in little loss of firepower or maneuverability but there will be times where you will want the action to slow down a bit.

Overall this game is pretty good but lacks enough gameplay variety and innovation to make it extremely good or even solidly good, even with the 1.5 version add-on DLC. The story is nonsensical and poorly developed (at least in english). The setting is unclear and the game's meaning is uncertain. This is basically just a little arcade style game to play once in a while. It's going to be best if you wait for a big steam sale and get this and some of its add-ons altogether for a fairly low price as it is definitely not worth 20 dollars or more.

32778471.review:
This is a fun, frustratingly tough Bullet Hell shoot-em-up.

Even on Normal Mode, the bullets come a lot faster than in some other shmups, with far more bullets that home in on you.
Trying to complete this game with no continues is a bloody nightmare, but if you just want to have some fun and don't care about getting points too much you can jsut power through with no real penalty, so it's pretty accessible even to newcomers.
The clear distinction between purple enemy fire and the player's own bullets makes it a lot less confusing. You always know what it is you're supposed to be avoiding.

It looks nice and the music is pretty good too. 
Really, if you have any interest in the genre, you won't do wrong with this one. It's as kind or as brutal as you want it to be and although it can get frustrating if you set too high a standard for yourself, you never actually want to stop playing; it's very addictive.
Sou yeah, do yourself a favour and get this one (or don't, not like I make any money from it...)

29548819.review:
独自の世界観に圧倒されるが、弾幕STGとしての完成度はトップレベルなのは間違いない。
さすが弾幕STGをこの世に生み出してしまったCAVEなだけに、弾幕に対する問題やおもしろさへの理解度は高く、本作はさまざまな点であらゆるユーザーにおすすめできる完成度を誇る。
アーケード版の移植であるノーマルモードの時点で、従来のSTGらしいモードか弾幕ゲームらしいモードをプレイヤーが選べるという仕様。そしてその上をいく超上級者向けのモードも搭載しながらも、それらを初心者向けに調整したノービスモードへ変更できる点が特に素晴らしい。
このノービスモードは単に弾を減らしたり敵を減らしたというような調整ではなく、完全に一から新しいゲームを作り直したといってもいいレベルの調整であり、初心者だけでなく多くのユーザーが楽しめる素晴らしいシステムとなっている。
つまり、圧倒的に多くのユーザーへの対応力が強い、というのがこの虫姫さまの特徴といえよう。
次第に中毒になるスコア稼ぎ、圧倒的な敵をさばき、窮地を切り抜ける快感、地形を読み戦略を立てる楽しさ。CAVEはまさに弾幕STGを最も理解した会社である。

29495241.review:
I'm going to preface this review with the following statement:

It's not for everyone. Holy hell, it's not for everyone.

This is a game whose main draw is slowly learning the game inside-out. If you get into it, you will spend inordinate amounts of time playing small stretches of gameplay over and over again, slowly memorizing each and every bullet pattern, enemy placement, and necessary positioning in order to survive said patterns.

If you just keep hitting "Continue", you'll see everything the game has to offer, with the exception of the true final boss, in less than half an hour.

If these things sound like turnoffs to you, just click away now, as Mushihimesama won't offer anything to you.

If you're willing to accept that, then Mushihimesama offers an extremely satisfying ride for fans of the bullet hell genre, and the inclusion of the "Original" difficulty mode may just help newer players get into it - though there are a few caveats.

I'm not going to bother with a plot synopsis, as it's pretty irrelevant and easily found elsewhere for the curious. It's a pretty simple premise, anyway, though sadly there are no subtitles for dialogue, and I've yet to find a translation anywhere.

The mechanics of the game are also fairly simple to pick up and understand. Three weapon types with differing movement speeds and (I believe) damage, each of which fires in a different pattern. Weapon power-ups, after a certain time, shift to a different type of weapon, which you'll gain if you pick them up in this state. You can also gain "Options" (little beetles who aid you via lasers) as the game goes on.

In terms of difficulty, the game's difficulty settings vary quite a bit - Original is a fairly comfortable ride, with quicker bullets but less of them. Maniac has much denser clouds of bullets that move more slowly, while Ultra has both the density and speed of the previous two, and is hideously difficult as a result. Naturally, the true final boss is only accessible on this difficulty - by completing the entire game from start to finish without using a continue.

Though really, I find the levels, while very tough, to be fairly doable. Except level 3, that level can get fucked.

No, it's the boss battles that tend to give me a run for my money. One reason level 3 is so hard - it's pretty much one long boss fight sans health bar, with a (kind of weirdly easy, at least by this game's standards) standard boss battle at the end. All the bosses play more or less the same - Fill the screen with a crapton of bullets while you do the same, and see who dies first. In general, it's me who dies first.

Then we get into the couple of caveats, and those are primarily related to a couple of bugs that Cave hasn't patched, and likely never will.

As far as I'm aware, there's a couple of issues with score recordings. I admit I haven't studied this particular issue extensively because I'm more concerned with trying to beat the game on one credit, so check around about that.

There's also a couple of situations where the game's emulated slowdown (that slowdown is intentional, yes), doesn't happen where it's supposed to, most notably on the first boss.

Oh, and the TLB's final attack is straight-up bullshit. You literally have to glitch the game and have a ton of lives in order to have a chance at completing it.

Overall, I'm of the opinion that Mushihimesama isn't half as good as its sequel, Mushihimesama Futari (Black Label edition). That's not to say Mushihimesama is bad, though; it's a great game for fans of bullet hell. It's just that its sequel is much better. That game's not on Steam, though, so we're stuck with Mushihimesama, and there are far worse games of this genre we could be stuck with.

29452723.review:
Mushihimesama (Literal Translation: "Hello Princess") is a SHooTing Game (commonly abbreviated as "SHT"), and although it came out last year, it feels like it came out over 10 years ago.



In case it wasn't obvious: That's my joke review. This is a great bullet-hell game, very challenging and very nice graphics and music. There's multiple modes and multiple difficulties, so if you suck, feel free to play on Novice Original (I 1CC'd it on my first try) and keep moving up.
The PC Port has nice features, such as tate mode, multiple backdrops, "extra screens" which can zoom in on a portion of your screen, so it's easier to see how many bombs or how much points you have.
Highly recommend for Bullet Hell fans, new and old.


Ignore the time I spent: I'll be playing it more, I just really wanted to make the joke review before I forget about it. But there's only 5 levels, a playthrough is roughly 30 minutes, but I think that's perfect length for a game challenging to 1CC

29284727.review:
I've only played couple of hours but based on my first impressions Mushihimesama is really good. I got into shmups via Touhou and this was only my second non-Touhou danmaku shooter, so take this review with a grain of salt idk lol plz no hate.

Things I liked:
+visuals: backrounds are interesting and enemies look menacing and pretty cool. I hope you're not afraid of bugs though.
+music: it's you everyday, nice backround music. Not too memorable maybe (at least in my opinion) but that's not a bad thing; it's there to make the game more enjoyable without distracting you too much.
+difficulty: the game is challenging, but (mostly) in a fair way.
+bullet patterns: more straightforward than in Touhou for example, but quite fun. They make you feel great about yourself when you finally get them.

What I liked less:
-bullets are all the same colour: this is a nitpick really, I just prefer colour coded bullets since they help you see the patterns and are visually more appealing. This colouring choise is still fine, since now you can easily separate the bullets from the backround. Like I said, it's a nitpick and more a matter of opinion.
-ultra mode ending (minor spoiler): I've played only on normal since I'm a scrub, but I've watched others play and ultra mode final Aki's phase is unfairly difficult, forcing you to manipulate edge-screen scroll and to die multiple times. In my opinion you shouldn't be forced to die in a shmup if you play well enough. And I haven't seen anyone NOT die on that last Aki's attack.

TL;DR: it's a quality shmup, but ultra mode can be frustrating (for wrong reasons).

28283640.review:
While I prefer the sequel, this is definitely one of the best shmups on Steam, and probably the best for beginners. Gameplay is simple shooting and dodging(most gshmups these days introduce additional mechanics). Most people probably know the series for its argueably cheap "ultra" difficulty mode, but the other 2 modes are very reasonable. 

[list]
  [*]"Original" mode cuts down on the number of bullets immensely compared to the other 2 difficulties, but keeps it from being too easy by increasing their speed. 
  [*]"Maniac" mode fills the screen with bullets, but they generally move relatively slowly. This gives you time to react to the situation, and plan a path through the bullets(or use a bomb if you think you won't survive)
  [*]"Ultra" mode is something most people likely won't spend much time with. In the arcades, it was unlocked either by entering a secret code or beating the game without continuing 50-100 times. The difficulty on this mode is brutal, and the last boss is outright unfair. 
  [*]"Arrange" mode was made for the non arcade releases. Not gonna go into it too much, as it's more of an "arrangement" of existing modes. Difficulty is a bit harder than maniac, and you get to fight a more reasonable version of the last boss of ultra mode. 
[/list]

Level design is extremely well done. It can be hard to tell the quality of the level design compared to any random bullet hell just by looking at it, but after spending many hours on the game it's easy to tell they put a lot of thought into the game. Third stage is also notable for being very unique among bullet hells. The entire stage has you fighting one giant bug, moving to and destroying various parts of its body. 

The sound is great too, especially the 1.5 OST DLC if you have it.

My biggest gripes are the graphics and the scoring. The art direction is fantastic sure, but the prerendered graphics don't do it justice. Scoring emphasizes memorization way too much, something the sequel improves on dramatically. Hopefully it makes it to Steam!

Шмап с аркадных автоматов про девочку на жуке. Если в детстве вы хотели подружиться с Навсикаей из долины ветров, или хотя бы просто смотрели кассету с звездным десантом и мечтали геноцидить членистоногих ракообразных жучилл,  то эта игра вам определенно придется весьма по нраву. В годы выпуска этой игры шмапы были в основном про всякие караблики в космосе и самолётики, и на момент выпуска эта игра была если не хитом, то весьма примечательной для фанатов жанра.
Сюжет прост. По сюжету деревня девчули отказалась следовать  традиции отдавать лолей в жертву жучиллам за мирное существование и была отравлена разгневанным жучиным божеством.15 летняя девочка спасает свой дом.
+ 
1 Игра динамичная и насыщенная эффектами/
2 Несколько режимов сложности, играть лучше на джойстике.
3 Автору обзора понравился саундтрек.
4 Пять уровней достаточно на 15+ часов благодаря нескольким режимам. С наскоку, без перезапуска уровня едва ли получится дойти до четвертого.
5 Ачивки, которыми реально можно гордиться самому.
6 Враги которые не дают заскучать, и разнообразием, и поведением.
7 Есть еще порты на пс2 и iOS. Порт на IOS качественнее, но посмотрел бы я на человека, проходящего эту игру на планшете/смартфоне без джойстика и посмеялся.
-
1 Один главный персонаж. Большие бомбы в угоду фансервису(плюс).
2 Лора могло бы быть и больше.
3 Не ремастер, разрешение на HD экранах не располагает к пристальному рассматриванию декораций.

Советы: специальная кнопка для перезапуска уровня сохранит больше ваших нервов и вы научитесь обходить сложные места, есть и режим тренировки для определенных участков. Как и во всяком шмапе двигаться лучше медленно и тут лучше двигаться постоянно, многие выстрелы врагов быстры и метки. После нескольких часов игры вы сами заметите как время замедляется и вы лучше чувствуете траектории полета пуль врагов.

26528576.review:
So far, the design seems to be very good. The controls are actually appropriate for the situations for the most part. The designers were actually merciful enough to give plenty of continues, granted it is certainly possible to 1 CC this game on its various modes, but it will take a very long time to do so.

Also, the graphics are absolutely stunning and it makes it easier to tell where the enemies are in terms of the background without requiring them to fire bullets. The various modes are also great for everyone from beginners to veterans of this genre.

Granted, I'm sort of a new player, but the gameplay is perfect and it works very well for this type of game. The difficulty curve is appropriate given that this is a PC port of an arcade game and those were designed to take quarters. However, there isn't really anything that can be improved from this that I can think of at the moment.

Oh yes, the music is very good as well and each of the bosses can be a bit of a treat to take on as well.

26245740.review:
The Bug Princess is finally widely available in the USA. Mushihimesama is one of Cave's most beautiful shooters and the culmination of a decade in developing the craft that is a modern shooter. Significant level of detail is given to enemy placement and movement, as well as bullet speed and patterns.

Quality Cave shooters are more like a well choreographed dances and Mushihimesama is maybe the pinnacle of Cave's efforts without relying heavily on fan service or tropes. The artwork and character sprites are absolutely gorgeous. The game comes with many options, monitor rotations, an arranged mode, and a 1.5 update.

This is a great shmup for the casual crowd, and Cave recognized that their games were becoming increasingly esoteric and pigeonholed for a very specific type of fan of the genre.  They decided to break away from genre tropes in the setting and art style, also reconsidering the way the player interacts with the game and bullet patterns.

このゲームは上は廃人から下は初心者まで、みんなが楽しく遊べるよう丁寧に作られています。
各個人の技量に応じた難易度が幅広く用意されているので
STGというジャンルに興味がある人には誰にでもおすすめできるんじゃないでしょうか。
その難易度の幅広さはというと
弾幕はちょっとって足踏みしちゃう人のために、弾幕じゃないモードまで用意してあるほどです。

ゲーム開始後の選択画面にて
弾幕じゃないモードが「スタンダード」で、弾幕モードが「マニアック」となっていて
この名前の付け方からして、初心者にはまず弾幕じゃないの方で遊んで慣れてもらって
それから弾幕に挑戦してもらおうというスタッフの意思が感じられますね。

それと実績のほとんどはノービスモードで解除可能でして
自分のような万年初心者でも、実績の9割くらいは解除できました。
なので実績を気にするような人でも気軽に購入できるのではないかと思います。

26047164.review:
From the makers of the legend "DonPachi" is Mushihimesama a must play for every fan of bullethell shooters.

Though this isn't the the "original" game from the arcade, we're looking at a, at least in my opinion, good port from the Xbox360 which supports arcade sticks without problems and doesn't show input lags or fps  issues as we know them from rather infamous other ports.

The story itself is exactly the same as on the arcade, no content was lost or even cutted out.
Compared to the original arcade which introduced Futari a bit later, this port offers a handy and flawless transition between 1.0 and 1.5 in the menu. (No restart or something of the sort)

For the graphic enthusiasts: Yes, the game is stretched rather than a full rework, but i guess that's absolutly fair considering the niche and i guess many players prefer the nostalgic effect from it anyways.

Overall i can really recommend the game, though i would like to warn newcomers of the huge learning curve! This game is noit really something for people which get frustrated easily!

25882685.review:
This is an excellent vertical bullet hell shoot em' up (shmup).

Everything in this game just feels right. Of course, I haven't gotten to the TLB, but so far so good.
The modes are quite diverse, with different feeling in each one. The  Novice mode is a nice addition to newcomers, although it will feel boring after a dive to the Original's Maniac mode, but it it a good place to get your first ever 1 credit clear before moving on to greater challenges.

Even though there are massive amount of bullets and you'll die a lot, it never gets frustrating. It doesn't even feel unfair, because controls are fluid and every mistake is yours alone. No invisible bullet syndrome here. And after a while of dying in the barrage of bullets you'll get better and it's very exhilarating to successfully dodge waves of bullets that might have seemed impossible before. I notice that my vocal cords produce funny sounds under pressure: different grunts and yells and laughs while dodging the impossible.

The main difference in Mushihimesama and other shmups is the beautiful, fantasy-like setting. Flying around surrounded by the lush greenery and colourful landscapes while butchering thousands of equally colourful and interesting bug creatures is really ...relaxing (?) in way. I think this is where the charm of Mushihimesama is. Most shmups are usually in a military setting or in space, so this is a welcome change of scenery. 

There are cool features like leaderboards for Score Attack mode and the option to watch other peoples replays to get better or uploading your own. There's even a training mode for all modes excluding novice (it doesn't need it anyway) for you to train specific levels with different settings. 

For newcomers to the game or genre, I suggest to try all the different modes of Normal before going to novice. Then laugh while the enemy falls before you before being able to do anything. Then get bored and go back to Normal Maniac to have some adrenaline-induced fun. (insert creepy yet somewhat satisfied but still craving smiley) Watch videos because they teach a lot. And don't get discouraged by inevitable losses or the intimidating barrage of bullets. Everything is surprisingly manageable with proper conditioning. And I still haven't been able to pass the third stage without continues in the original game. But I know I will.

25466519.review:
I am quite new in the world of shmups and Mushihimesama is the first danmaku I've ever played. Gameplaywise Mushihimesama differs quite much from the most of the (newer indie) releases found on Steam. Therefore Mushihimesama is a very welcome addition to Steam's catalog. Additionally Mushihimesama seems to be best of those releases on Steam.

Instead of shooting enemies, the gameplay comes much to dodging and situation analysis (here I can dodge there, now I can dodge there and shoot that one, now I blank and panic and use bomb). Little by little player's situation analysis skills develop and panic-bombing can be saved later in the game.

The pace of the game is very high and player needs to be constantly push his/her consentration and sit on the edge of the seat. Mushihimesama kind of reminds me from the good old times (I never actually experienced) when computers had names, joystics were the thing and video games came much to constantly retrying that seemingly infinite (actually 20 min long) game myriad of times, which can be surprisingly fun :)

Edit: For all those Linux gamers let it be to known that Wine needs glsl set to disabled (winetricks glsl=disable). I also have CSMT set on, but not sure if it boosts performance. If glsl isn't set disabled ultra difficulty and arrange mode become unplayable. The game still might suffer from slight fps drops in the most intense parts after disabling glsl but after a short Windows session, I'd suspect most of them occur also while playing on native Windows. Good way to test performance is plow through level or two on arrange mode with using continues.

機能面のレビューです。ウィンドウズ10で動作確認しています。


画面サイズの大きさ調整の自由度が高く、
ウィンドウ表示・フルスクリーン表示でも16:9と4:3が選ぶ事が可能で
さらにゲーム本編画面の拡大縮小・上下左右へ延ばせる数値は
50％～200％まであり、市販の一般的なワイドモニターはもちろん、
ワイドではない旧サイズモニターでもピッタリ合わせる事が可能です。

映像の調整はメインメニューからのオプションと
ゲーム本編のポーズ中からのオプションメニューとでは
内容が異なりますので、両方での調整が必要です。

壁紙の明るさを0に設定することで壁紙を真っ黒にできます。
（壁紙真っ黒の設定が無いゲームが意外と多いのですよ）


映像の画質はゲーセンタイプとスムージングを選べます。


縦画面モードは画面の左倒し・右倒しが選択可能
コントローラーの向き変更も対応できます。


キーコンフィグ画面含め、このゲームは
XBOX360コントーローラーを基準としています。



ビットトレードワン製のREVIVE USBが使用可能です。


キーボードのキー設定も可能です。


このゲームはスタートボタン・項目確定・項目キャンセルなどの
基本的なボタン機能の割り当て変更はできません。


BGM・効果音・ボイスの音量が調整可能です。

アレンジBGMはゲーム本編全てアレンジBGMにするほかに
ステージごと、ボス、クリアー時など場面ごとに細かく
オリジナルBGMとアレンジBGMのどちらかを選べます。

録画ハイスコアラー派には便利な
スコア部分の拡大を配置可能。

Escキーを押してのゲーム強制終了はありません。
(Escキーもポーズボタンを兼ねています)

AltキーとF4キーを押しての強制終了は可能です。




ゲーム環境作りにおける機能面についての問題は
一切見当たりません。

25133097.review:
2004年10月在大型機台上堆出，2005年PS2版推出，直到2015年才在Steam上重製。

維持古早味大型機台的遊戲畫面，但是整體像素有所提升，就彈幕遊戲來說，CAVE社的蟲姬還是薑老得辣，玩得讓人回味無窮，讓人真心享受被溫暖的紫色球體包圍的感覺。

關卡數不多，約三十分鐘可以完成一輪，但是會一直想挑戰更高難度或訓練降低死亡次數。整體遊戲偏中高，雖然採線判定較鬆、可調自機速度精密閃躲，但是波濤洶湧[strike](不是女主角胸部)[/strike]的彈幕，還是會讓你眼睛死亡(爆)。回憶家機老闆看見蟲姬笑呵呵的情景[strike](也不是因為女主角)[/strike]，而是學生們一枚一枚投進去的硬幣都不知道可以買多少款蟲姬了(咦?!)。

喜歡彈幕遊戲的玩家，一定要入手蟲姬，彈幕遊戲新手不用怕，還是有入門模式讓你玩的。

評分：10.0 / 10.0 
扣分原因：
◆ 找不到扣分原因，最後關卡，男豬第二輪彈幕太夭壽、超虐手可以拿來扣分嗎?!
◆ 聽說主程式不太穩，有機會遇到FPS非60崩潰BUG？我沒遇過就是了。

24772986.review: 确实是不褪色的经典。PS2时期最早的几张盘之一，可惜了弹幕游戏已经变成了时代的眼泪、除了东方同人系列已经很少有厂商还能充满热情的制作了，遗憾，这部作品的人设怪设爽快度都是满分，难度更不用说。唯一的问题就是背景和敌人配色太过于接近让人看得眼睛疼--而且地图上的宝石简直是挡视线神器，动不动就让我吃着吃着就死掉。好游戏卡也超贵，我想和成个勋章都舍不得。。。总之，对于热爱老游戏的我老说，是能玩到废寝忘食的好游戏，推荐大家都来试试吧，不是只有开放加沙盒才是好游戏，3A的狂轰烂炸之后，虫姬这样的珍珠显得更加珍贵

24646123.review:
原作是2004年Cave的街机端STG，现在移植到了PC端。
Pros
1.游戏的经典性，这点不用多提了。
2.游戏内容完整，难度跨度大，适合大量玩家。有适合新手的Novice模式，有以前在XBOX端Arrange模式，也有正常的Normal模式，还包括了一个1.5模式的DLC。对于Novice和Normal模式，还有Original,Maniac,Ultra三种难度可以选择。游戏有从Novice模式相当简单的Original难度（亲民虫超亲民？）到难度为42的Normal模式的Ultra难度，并且有相当完整的练习模式（Novice模式没有Training）。因此从休闲型的stg玩家到街机stg的高手，都可以很好地享受这一款游戏
3.游戏的BGM还是相当不错的。在烘托战斗气氛的方面相当赞，Normal、Arrange、1.5模式的BGM也各有变化。
Cons
1.按键设置存在缺陷。如无法映射Shift键，对于本人这样习惯Shift,z,x打飞机的机师还是需要一段时间的适应。

因此，总评10/10。无论是娱乐型机师还是打飞机的触手，都是一款相当值得入手的游戏。

24342492.review:
Mushihimesama is a game that I went back and forth over buying for quite some time.  I'd heard stories of CAVE's arcade shmups (especially DoDonPachi, Espgaluda, and Ketsui) for years, but had never actually had the opportunity to play any of them.  Upon seeing Mushihimesama on Steam I was excited, but after watching the trailer I decided to hold off on it.  I'm not sure exactly what it was about the trailer, but it failed to sell me the game.  I'm sure the rumors I heard that it wasn't a very good port didn't help matters either.  Eventually I decided to pick it up anyway, and I'm really glad that I did.  Perhaps you shouldn't always judge a game by its trailer.

Although I've never played any of their other games, it's my understanding that Mushihimesama plays similarly to other CAVE games.  Your “ship” in this game is actually the main character Reco riding on a golden beetle named Kiniro.  Reco's hitbox is tiny, which is good, because saying, “there are a lot of bullets to avoid” would be a massive understatement.  CAVE certainly lives up to their reputation.  Depending on the difficulty setting, the enemy bugs will fire an astounding number of bullets, sometimes filling the majority of the screen.

Fortunately for beginners, there are quite a few different ways to adjust the difficulty.  The game has three different modes: novice, normal, and arrange.  Novice and normal are further broken down into original, maniac, and ultra.  Arrange doesn't have any additional difficulty options but features a different soundtrack, maximum attack power and options, auto-bombing on hit, and different enemy locations.  In addition to normal modes of play there is also a rather robust training mode where you can practice specific stages.  There really is a difficulty mode here for everyone here.

There are three different attack modes to choose from when you start the game.  The difference between the three deals with the movement speed of Reco/Kiniro and the spread of your attack (narrow to wide).  All of the attack modes have the ability to perform a concentrated fire attack which heavily slows your speed.  This is particularly useful for precise movement when navigating through bullet dense areas.  There are also two modes for options: trace and formation.  The attack mode and option mode can be changed by collecting the corresponding power up during the game.  In addition to weapons and options, Reco also has screen clearing bombs at her disposal which are very useful for getting out of sticky situations.

As far as the rumors of Mushihimesama being a bad port, it's difficult for me to judge as I never played the original arcade release.  The game looks and sounds great.  The only issue I experienced was a single crash in almost twenty hours of gameplay.  Perhaps It should be noted that you can stretch the screen so it reaches the top and bottom of your monitor.  I didn't realize this at first and spent some time playing with the default settings.  As far as I can remember all the previous shmups I've played stretch it out by default.

Mushihimesama is a lot of fun, and I've ended up spending a lot more time playing it than I thought I would.  It's the sort of game that validates the phrase, “practice makes perfect.”  You can play casually through the game in about 30 minutes or you can spend countless hours trying to clear each difficulty mode without using a continue.  This is a game that I would definitely recommend.  I hope more CAVE games are brought to Steam in the future.

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/25660729-CelerySpin/]Like the review? Follow my curator page to see my thoughts on other games.[/url]

24046629.review:
Originally released for Arcade in 2004 and later ported to other systems such as PS2 and Xbox 360, Mushihimesama is a shoot 'em up (shmup) game belonging to a sub-genre called danmaku aka bullet hell developed by japanese company Cave which is one of the experts in producing this type of game. For those not familiar with danmakus, I usually define as a type of shmup characterized by gameplay fast, intense and frantic with the enemies "urinating" bullets all the time, defying dexterity and motor skills of the player who often have millimetric spaces to dodge the bullets and hit your enemies. Mushihimesama has excellent quality with top gameplay, great music, excellent controls and a particular thing that I find really cool about this game is its thematic involving the natural world and insects, because you control a princess named Reco using as "craft" a large golden beetle called Kiniro in the fight against insects, just remember that most often in the shmups the environment is set to futuristic times with high-tech ships, so Mushihimesama has a differential. ケイブのシューティングゲームは難しいというイメージを持っている人もいるかもしれませんが、このゲームは本当の初心者向けにNoviceモードが用意されており、そちらの出来がいいので安心です。

また、80年代、90年代のアーケードでのシューティングゲームが好きだったけど、弾幕シューの流行でアーケードのシューティングゲームについていけなくなったという人にはNormalモードでのORIGINALがお勧めです。東亜プランのシューティングを洗練した感じで、事前にルールを深く覚える必要もなく、適当にきた弾を避けつつ撃ち込み、危ないときにボムを撃って、あとは慣れればクリアできるゲームです。死んでもパワーダウンしませんし、その場復活なので特定の場所でハマり続けることもありません。

NoviceだとヌルすぎるけどNormalのORIGINALは弾速が速すぎると感じる方には、DLCですがver.1.5のORIGINALがお勧めです。バランス調整されていて、非常に遊びやすいです。個人的にはこれが特にお勧めです。

Normalやver.1.5でのORIGINALが楽勝になったら、MANIACやULTRAがありますので、長く楽しめると思います。

なお、Windows10 Pro(64bit版)でのRadeon HD7750で快適に遊べています。グラフィックボードを外して、オンボードでも十分遊べました。

Must have for every Bullet Hell maniac.

22446847.review:
Amazing game. Original mode is an intense shooter (more about fast, sparse bullet patterns than what most people would think of as "bullet hell") that's actually fairly accessible for people new to the genre - once they acclimate to its speed, at least. Maniac mode (a more traditional bullet hell-style mode) is excellent as well, and then there's the for-experts-only Ultra. On top of that, there's also the Novice modes (enjoyable for newcomers) and the 1.5 DLC (a great thorough rebalancing that changes up the scoring system and adds new enemy placements, as well as the exciting MAX modifier that gives both you and your enemies drastic powerups). At this point, it goes without saying that one of this game's biggest strengths is its wide variety in modes - it really does cater to players of all skill levels.

Mushihimesama is aesthetically brilliant, too. The soundtrack is great, the giant bug theme makes for a lot of really cool enemy types (how many other shmups have you fighting gigantic antlions, pitcher plants, or water striders?), and the colorful environments are lush with gorgeous details - the art is fantastic all around. 

This game is easily recommendable to anyone with interest in shmups.

22136710.review:
シンプルな弾幕シューティングゲームです
多少の波はあれどCAVEのシューティングゲームは良作が多いのですが「虫姫さま」はその中でも傑作の一つだと思います
グラフィックも音楽もゲームとしてのバランスも良い作品です

◆システム
ゲームの特徴として一番に挙げられるのが「非常にシンプル」だということです
連続して敵を倒す、特殊な行動で敵を倒す、一定の条件で得点アイテムを取得する...等の稼ぎ要素はありません
『撃つ』『避ける』『ボム』の3つだけです
そのため、細かいシステムを知らなくても爽快感を味わえます
（もちろん稼ぐためのシステムはありますが派手な演出はありません）
2周目もなく1周で終わるので細かいことは気にせずに各ステージ、ボスの攻略に専念できます
ゲームモードは複数ありますがシューティングゲーム部分はとてもシンプルです

◆ゲームモード
ゲームモードは大きな分類が3種類あり、そこからまた3種類選ぶ形式になっています

・ノーマルモード
　アーケード版を移植したメインのモードです。ゲーム内に3つのモードがあり、オリジナル、マニアック、ウルトラからモードを選択します
オリジナルは弾の数が少ないが弾の速度が速い、マニアックは弾の数が多く弾の速度が遅い、ウルトラはマニアックの高難易度モードです
マニアックを普通の弾幕STGの基準として考えてもらうのが手っ取り早いかな、と思います
普通のシューティングゲームと比べ、オリジナルもマニアックも難易度は高めです

・ノービスモード
　アーケード版の低難易度バージョンです。ノーマルモードと同じ、オリジナル、マニアック、ウルトラの3種類があります
難易度は大幅に下がっているので、シューティングゲームが初めての人でもカジュアルに遊べると思います

・アレンジモード
　最初からフルパワーで始まったり、敵の攻撃方法が変わっていたりノーマルモードから色々変更されているモードです
アレンジモードにはオリジナル、マニアック、ウルトラのモードはありません
ノービスモードよりはかなり難しくなっていますが、ノーマルモードよりは簡単な難易度です

◆遊び方
上述した通りですが、難易度は、ノーマル>アレンジ>>>ノービスという感じなので、弾幕STGが初めての人やSTGが苦手な人はノービスモードがおすすめです
東方シリーズなどの弾幕STGや他のシューティングゲームをカジュアルに遊んでいる人もノーマルやアレンジがちょっと難しいかな、と思ったらノービスモードを最後まで流してみると遊び方が見えてくると思います
モードの組み合わせによって弾幕がかなり変わるので、色々なモードに手を出して自分が遊びやすい難易度で練習しながらノーマルやアレンジのノーコンテニュークリアーを目指すといいでしょう

◆総評
2004年にアーケードで稼働したゲームの移植ですが、「CAVEの弾幕STG」というだけでなくシューティングゲームとして完成度の高いゲームなので今遊んでも十分に楽しめます
定価は2000円ですが中身はフルプライスのゲームです
古いゲームだから、弾幕STGが苦手だから、移植だからと敬遠せずに、ちょっとでも興味があるなら買って損はしないと思います

正直なところ、Steam版を遊ぶまで「虫姫さま」はあまり好きではありませんでした
ゲームセンターでの稼働当初は虫姫さまの難易度が高く感じられ、数ゲームしか遊んだ記憶がありません（1面と2面の敵配置がちょっといやらしいのが原因かな？）
ただ、お布施としてSteam版を購入し、アレンジモードで遊んだところ、自分の中で「虫姫さま」が糞ゲーから超良ゲーに変わりました(笑)
アレンジモードはプレイヤーを分かりやすく誘導してくれる弾幕や敵配置があり、プレイヤーに「虫姫さま」の遊び方を教えてくれます
（怒首領蜂シリーズをプレイした方はなんとなく分かるでしょうか...？）
このアレンジモードのおかげで、ノーマルモードも普通に楽しめるようになり、ゲームセンターでもたまにプレイするようになりました

とにかく、レビューの最初に書いた通り「シンプルな弾幕シューティングゲーム」で遊びやすく、カジュアルゲーマーからコアなシューターまで楽しめます
遊びやすい、完成度高い、安い、3拍子揃ったゲームです

22012462.review:
Mushihimesama is a brilliant CAVE shooter that is a direct port of the 360 version, available for people on PC for the first time. Mushihimesama sets a standard in terms of modern STGs and cave games in general that we can get a taste for and is absolutely worth your time.

[h1] Gameplay[/h1]
Vertical shooter, you control 1 ship called Reco and you have a choice of 3 different shot types they are :
M-Power (best all round shot type)
W-Power (wide shot type for clearing large groups of enemies in stages, low mobility)
S-Power (powerful concentrated attack good for taking out bosses and single targets, fastest)
In game certain enemies drop the icon which gives you the power ups, there is a timer that counts down if you don't collect the power up within the time it switches to a different shot type which could be good if you need it for a specific boss enemy,or you are looking to clear specific enemies meaning it helps you plan more strategic.
There are 3 bombs given to you at the start but not like the classic screen clear bombs you get given a bomb that affects a certain area, you are still invincible during its active frames but you have to aim where you want it to go.It is also used in advanced techniques such as misdirection allowing you to have a better chance of surviving challenging patterns.
You start with 2 lives, and the first 1-up is available with a score of 10000000, there are a total of 5 stages and every stage has a mini boss and under certain conditions during the 5th stage you can get the true last boss.

[h1] Scoring [/h1]
During original mode the scoring mechanics are quite simple and to get good scoring you have to master surviving to gain the 1cc. Basically to get good scores you need to achieve NMNB (No miss No Bomb) The enemies drop gems and there are small and large diamond gems, small gems are worth 100 points, large ones 1000 which are dropped by airborne enemies. There are also gems for grounded enemies with small grounded gems worth 825 points and 2000points respectively.
The number of gems collected during the current life on the current stage with a bonus from no missing is added together as a score bonus at the end of each stage, and at the end of the final stage the number of lives remaining and bombs are multiplied resulting in the final score.

In the maniac and ultra mode, there is a counter called the parent counter and it increases when Reco is shooting enemies on the screen with her shot and decreases whenever she is not hitting an enemy, each enemy has their own counter that is similar to the parent counter and decreases if Reco is not shooting at it until it dies, and the higher the mulitiplier the more score you will recieve.You can gain an option powerup, a new counter called the child counter,the child counter will only increase if the options laser is hitting an enemy using her main shot, an advanced technique called counter banking allows you to use the C shot for example, if a player has 4 child counters with a vaulue of 500 each, everytime you counter bank, you will add 2000 to the parent counter causing your multiplier to skyrocket, mastering the technique and keeping track of your score and chaning will allow your parent counter to improve your score dramatically.

Overall Mushihimesama is an amazing game and in HD from its original 2004 arcade release, it looks amazing and worthy of being released on PC in 2015, its challenging with different modes for every skill level and you can spend months and years playing this game.

My only gripe is that it doesn't clearly say that "1" is the start button to needed to continue. Had to look it up in the forums.
Other than that, this is a timeless classic of the bullet hell genre that still holds plenty of fun today. I had no problems with the port outside of some slowdown when tons of stuff is exploding (which actually still ran smooth and looked really cool.) 
It's pretty neat seeing the same game through 3 different iterations (Classic, Arrange, & 1.5) and how it evolved the simple idea of "don't touch the purple stuff." I fully recommend it to those who enjoy looking for the method in the madness to squeeze through, and who don't mind raging at that secret, final boss with it's bullshit shield and the insane flower-bullet patterns (where am I supposed to go?!)

21108139.review:
2004年に稼働してから11年経った作品だが今見ても色あせない。
怒首領蜂をリリースしたCAVEが新たな試みも含めて世に送り出した作品と言える。
タイトル通り虫が主体、謎の病から里を救うべくレコ姫様が生贄として「甲獣神」に会いに行くと言うお話。
(彼女が乗ってるカブトムシは森で出会ったお友達、今回は生贄(レコ姫)を送り届ける役目を与えられてる)

前置きはこの辺にして各モードの解説
"オリジナルモード"
CAVE作品にしては珍しく敵弾が少ないクラシカルでシンプルなモード。だが序盤から高速弾が襲い掛かってくる。
初心者向けに位置付けられているが実際には”初心者が比較的取っ付きやすい"に過ぎなかったりする。
最近の弾幕シューティングに飽き飽きしているプレイヤーならいい気分転換にもなるかと。

"マニアックモード"
CAVE作品らしい弾幕が襲い掛かるモード。おびただしい量の弾が襲い掛かるが弾速はかなり抑えられている。
初心者にはきつい弾の数だがかと言って初心者非推奨って事はないのでこのモードから始めてもよいかと。
打ち込みカウンタと呼ばれるスコアボーナスシステムがあるが、これはショットを当て続ける事でスコアが跳ね上がる。
プレイ人口が一番多いモードと思われる。

"ウルトラモード"
このさきには
暴力的で
鬼のような
獄殺甲獣どもが
あなたをまっています。

それでもプレイしますか?

【はい】　　　　 いいえ

このモードはちょっと逝っちゃってる人の為のモードです。(ケイブの過去作品の2周目に相当する)
冗談抜きに警告が出ます。一般人がプレイすると獄殺甲獣どもになす術もなくやられてしまうでしょう。
このモードとARRANGEのみ真ボス(アキ&アッカ)が出ます。

このように本家(AC版。Steam版ではNORMAL)だけでも一粒で３度おいしい物となっています。
更には真の意味で初心者向けと言えるNOVICE、マニアックモードをベースにアレンジしたARRANGEと更に間口が広くなっています。
(Xbox360版に近いとの事)
1.5とOSTに関してはココでは除外します。

武装はメインショットとオプションがあり

[メインショット]
"M-POWER"
標準に位置付けられてるメインショット。すべての面でWとSの中間と言える。
"W-POWER"
攻撃範囲が広いが接射しないと威力が低い。(逆に接射時の威力は最大)
移動速度が遅いのできめ細かい弾避けが得意な反面、弾の壁が襲い掛かって来た時には回避が間に合わない事も…
"S-POWER"
攻撃範囲が狭いが安定した火力を持つ。遠距離での威力は最大。(逆に接射時の威力は最低)
移動速度が速いので素早い位置取りや大胆な回避が得意なものの、きめ細かい弾避けにはその速さがが仇になりがち。

[オプション]
"トレース"
どう見ても○○ディウスの挙動。扱いには少々コツが要るがオプション配置の自由度が高い。
"フォーメーション"
まんまサン○ーク○スの配置。癖がなく扱いやすい。右→左→右→左の順に装備される。

ショットボタン押しっぱなしでオプション収束&移動速度DOWN。更に当たり判定も表示される。
そして危なくなったらボンバー投下。敵と弾を一掃しましょう。

このように初心者から超人までウェルカムな間口の広さ、複雑怪奇すぎないシステム、極小の当たり判定、個性豊かな虫たちなどあらゆる面で高い評価を受けていてかつゲームとしての面白さ、難しい部類に入るがやりがいのある難易度(ウルトラなど極端な物もあるが)と今でも色あせる事のない名作と言えるでしょう。縦シューティングに触れたことが無い人にも是非プレイして欲しい。
縦置き可能なディスプレイをお持ちでしたら尚更おすすめです。縦表示も可能ですよ。

同時に難点も…
まずNORMAL基準だが上にも書いた通りオリジナルモードでもハッキリ言って縦シューティング初心者にはつらい難易度、ちょん避け(レバーを一瞬だけ入れて回避するテクニック)で済む事も多いとは言え敵弾がかなり速いので反射神経と動体視力が求められる。そして死因(ミスの原因)も大半は事故死だったりする。
マニアックはマニアックで弾の数が容赦ない、それだけでなく弾と弾の隙間が意外と狭い。回避しようとして逆に弾にあたってしまう事も… 得点稼ぎなら特にショットを当て続ける様に立ち回らないとスコアがガタ落ちする。
もっとも、コレはコレで面白かったりする。NORMALでつらいのならNOVICEでプレイするのも手。
虫が苦手な人は正直つらいかも…

他にはボタン設定はスタートボタンが自由に割り当てられない、十字キーがボタンとして割り当てられてるゲームパッドはJoyToKeyなどを併用しないとどうしようもない、1Pは強制的にID1が割り当てられて使いたいパッドを自由に割り当てられない、解像度の変更が出来ないなどむしろシステム面の不備が頂けない。この辺りは正直残念でもある。
声優さんは素人声優(CAVE社員との事)なので棒読みや鼻声は気にしないで下さい。

余談になりますがレコ姫はアキ(甲獣神。棒読み王子とも)に恋心を抱いてる節があるように見えます。
あと彼女は履いてないそうです。何とは言いませんが。
以上、長文失礼しました。

20833762.review:
I love this game :)

This is a bullet hell shoot'em up that, like most good games of its genre, possesses a lot of depth and challenge, especially when you start focusing on scoring. Replaying each stage and constantly learning new things and improving your survivability/score is a lot of fun!

Aside from Normal mode, this game provides a Novice mode (less/slower enemy bullets) and Arrange mode (different bullet patterns). If you own the DLC, you get access to the V1.5 mode (different enemy placements and bullet patterns). Normal and Novice modes provide 3 difficulty challenges each, with more complicated bullet patterns and scoring systems in higher difficulties.

I find the soundtrack awesome and quite catchy overall. Arrange and V1.5 modes have their own sets of remixed soundtracks, which you can also assign to other modes to keep the background music fresh.

The game came out with a few bugs but, as of this review, most of them, as far as my experience goes, have been resolved. I also find the more complicated scoring systems, present in higher difficulties or in certain modes, a bit convoluted at first, while the game doesn't do enough to explain them, which will require checking a guide or two.

If you like bullet hell shoot'em up games, this is is a very well-crafted and gorgeous one. If you don't like them, this might still be worth checking out, but will likely not change your mind. If you haven't tried any and you're curious about the genre, this is a good place to start, with its Novice mode serving as a nice starting point.

20493636.review:
While it is great to see Cave release their games on the PC platform, their first release leaves a little bit be desired when it comes to options.

I'll get it out of the way right away, this is a port of the XBOX 360 version and not much was really changed from that port. That means no graphic options and the game is stuck at 1280x720 and the game suffers from some vertical tearing due to lack of V-Sync. Other than that, the controls can be fully rebound on Keyboard an controllers.

Now, the game itself its pretty fun. If you do not know, Mushihimesama is what people would call a ''bullet hell'' due to amount of bullets on the screen at once. You play through 5 stages and face the final (and a secret-final boss if you meet the requirements) and that's it... Or is it?!
Actually, no! Mushihimesama does offer enough content for both beginners and experts of the genre in order to provide them the most out of the game.

First of all, you have several modes of play which includes a novice modes for newcomers, the original game with the three main difficulty settings, an arrange mode focused on high scoring and lastly a DLC 1.5 revision of the game which changes the way some of mechanics of the game work out too. If you think you need to practice a stage or a boss, you can always chose your mode (Except novice for some reasons) then play the section you want until you master.

At its core, the gameplay of Mushihimesama consist of shooting down enemies and bosses while avoiding a big amount of bullets on-screen as mentioned previously. While it may seem overwhelming at first, you'll notice that your player's hitbox is a very small blue dot that appears when doing a ''focused'' attack. The scoring sysem does vary depending on the mode you chose and if you are interested in learning more about it, I suggest looking up scoring guides on steam. They are very helpful and teach you how it all works.

Now do I have some issues with the game other than the poor PC options and screen tearing? Yes, I do.

One thing the game could do it better label the prompts in the menues and what the button imputs do on the option screen when rebinding them. It took me some time before finding out that the two fire buttons it gives you do different things, since it was never labeled. No instruction manual is provided with the game either as far as I know.

A second problem is the arcade emulation. To a veteran, this is going to sound like a weird complaint because that's usually a good thing if the game is true to the arcade original. The problem with Cave's games is the slowdown when the screen is cluttered. The game constantly speeds down and speeds up when it gets hectic and I've personally never liked that in a game as it usually becomes incredibly distracting and tends to get me killed during the phases due to the controls slowing up and down all the time. I enjoy games that never slow down and I can't get for the life of me why an option to remove them was not added. Some arcade ports (Like the fantastic Gradius Collections on the PSP system) added a way to remove hardware slow down and the overall experience is, in my opinion, better.

Though the game's biggest issue is hat it has to save CONSTANTLY.
Here's how often it does it; It saves when you chose a game mode. It saves when you quit training mode to get back into the training settings. It saves when you change the options (fair enough). It saves when the game is over. It saves when you go back to the main menu.
It gets irritating really quickly because you just want to get back to the previous menu without interuptions, and those 5 seconds it takes to save  every single time you do something adds up. I don't have any other games that saves as often as this one and it again shows this is a rather poor PC port in terms of technical fidelity.

Overall, is Mushihimesama worth its asking price. Personally, I think 20$ is a bit much considering there are cheaper offerings that are as good as this game and I find releasing the V1.5 mode as DLC on day 1 to be of poor taste considering this game is old, very old in fact. If it was 20$ for the whole package (including the soundtrack) this would be an absolute positive recommendation from me. As of now, I can recommend this game to people who don't mind the retail price and would like to either get into the genre or for veterans who never played this game. It's a pretty fun game.
Or you can always wait for a sale, but that's up to you.

20048572.review:
An arcade style bullet hell shooter brought to you by Cave, the masters of the bullet hell genre, and a must-have for any danmaku fan out there.

Mushihimesama is a 2D horizontal SHMUP which lets you control princess Reco on her quest to stop the Koju from attacking a human village. You get to make your way through dense bullet patterns requiring both quick thinking and reflexes in 5 stages.

In terms of gameplay the game is simple like every SHMUP. You shoot enemies for points while avoiding enemy fire. The difficulty ranges from challenging to exceptionally tough. The enemies and bosses have fun and challenging bullet patterns.

The graphics are great for a 2D shooter. Sadly the game only supports up to 720p resolution but allows full screen stretching. The screen settings also support 90 degree flipping, for those that want the true arcade experience.

The soundtrack is great and fits the game's atmosphere. Boss themes got a bit of a dramatic touch in them, stage themes are adventurous or mysterious, depending on where you are.

Overall I love this game. It pretty much outclasses every other similar SHMUP available on Steam, and the only game coming close to it is Crimzon Clover: WORLD IGNITION. If you love getting punished by beautiful bullet patterns, then go buy it. If you're not familiar with the SHMUP genre, avoid the game (for now) as the insane difficulty will make you regret buying it.

19972271.review:
I won't write a review for the game itself, you can already find countless of them on steam and over the internet. I'll just review the port. I've waited for some time and observed how things were going before either bashing or praising the port. After 2 months, much has happened, things are more or less settled so I think it's the right moment.

At release, let's be honest, game was in a clumsy state: crash problems, leaderboards problems, rendering problems and what not. It was far from the Batman disaster hopefully, but it could definitely have been better. Since it was CAVE first PC release, I think it would have been wiser from them to do like SNKP with KoF XIII and let users pre-purchase the game in beta so they could benefit from their feedback and bug reports. Which is more or less what happened here, except it is not what we expected, and thus, not paid for.

But we can't go back in time so let's look forward instead : since the 6th november (so in less than 2 months when I write this review), they have released no less than 6 patches, most issues have been addressed and they still listen to players for the few issues remaining. They work hard, and fast. They acknowledge their mistakes and do their best to fix them.

I wouldn't have recommended Mushihimesama at its release. Frankly. But now, there's no reason to keep your wallet closed for this game. CAVE devs proved that they are concerned and dedicated to the quality of their ports. They have proved it was more than a mere cash grab. Now we can wait for their future releases with an optimistic state of mind.

19969279.review:
Выглядит как клон DoDonPachi, даже паттерны похожие, а первый уровень — так вообще копия. 

На экране творится форменная эпилепсия, требуется напрягать глаза, чтобы различить вражеские снаряды на фоне своих. Концентрация взрывов и разрушения на единицу времени потрясает. Всё вокруг моргает, блестит, окружение динамически меняется, уничтоженные враги оставляются после себя рои золотых штучек. Это всё конечно весело, но исключает вдумчивое и аккуратное прохождение. Пробежался по уровням, устроил бомбфест с континуусами, и почти не увидел интересных паттернов. С одной стороны уровни завалены стандартами, которые тупо стримятся, с другой сложность создается моментами вида "а вот сейчас выскочит стрекоза и засыпет тебя спамом, если её вовремя не убить".

Обычная игра для игровых автоматов: яркая и красочная со стороны, но уналая на деле. Быстро начал, настрелял тонну врагов, быстро умер, следующий. Чтобы пройти игру полностью за одну "монетку", нужно зубрить уровни, а графика, музыка и сама игра к этому совершенно не располагают.

Если хочется поиграть во что-то подобное, то лучше обратить внимание на Exceed 3rd, благо она есть на стиме. Симпатичная графика, озвученные диалоги и музыка получше.

19960250.review:
Mushi is a defining bullet hell shmup by Cave, a Japanese company that re-popularized the genre among hardcore gamers in Japan. In fact, during my last visit to Japan I visited several arcades with a shmup corner and about 90% of it's game were by Cave, all still running for years where most other arcade shmups died.

So what makes these games so special? That might differ per person. To me it's the balanced gameplay, visuals, and music thst makes them feel like am interactive rollercoaster ride. To some it's the challenge of clearing it with one credit, or learning the excellent scoring systems.

Mushi itself has it's main focus on pattern reading. It takes the bullet patterns from Dodonpachi to a new level by letting enemies spawn the weirdest patterns. For the rest, well, go see for yourself.

What can I say what hasn't already been said? Mushi is still a top-notch shmup. Go download and play if you love bullet hell!

19928052.review:
[i]Mushihimesama[/i] is such a love/hate relationship for me.

The art and music are arguably the biggest selling points, still lush and elaborate as I remember them from my first experience with the game on the PlayStation 2, a notably barebones, mediocre, but at the time novel port.

This conversion of the Xbox 360 release is certainly more impressive in comparison despite the lack of proper resolution support, sufficiently equipped with enough alternate modes and difficulty settings to keep all but the pickiest bullet hell fans potentially busy for years to come.

Controls, arcade accuracy... no complaints; everything is how it should be.

So what's the problem, you might ask?

The challenge.

It's been nearly twenty years and CAVE still doesn't understand how to build challenge for anything that isn't running on a glorified quarter vacuum, their sole focus still centered around the high score. Outside of a pedantic, competition-driven few, no one cares about scores the moment a game steps away from the arcade and into their home collection; not a single one. It's a pointless endeavor that severely hampers [i]Mushihimesama[/i] (et al.) at a core level.

In truth? There is no challenge here. Credits are unlimited; anything beyond a self-imposed 1cc rule offers nothing of real value or satisfaction and for a game rooted so heavily in a gameplay-centric genre, it more or less results in creative suicide.

Granted, this is not a problem exclusively endemic to [i]Mushihimesama[/i] or the rest of CAVE's library; bullet hell as a niche has been guilty of it from the start, a major reason behind my strong preference for the classic array of shmups ([i]Gradius[/i], [i]R-Type[/i], anything by Compile). Still, I've tried to keep an open mind, revisiting the classic titles off and on over the years, but at the end of the day... I just don't understand the overall appeal beyond a very particular mindset. Probably never will, even if I should theoretically love the hell out of this game without question.

Final verdict: worth it if you're a part of the aforementioned mindset and/or a genre enthusiast. Everyone else? I wouldn't bother beyond potential novelty factor.

19669443.review:
Cave, the gods of bullet hell finally have arrived on steam.
I was first introduced to this genre by Donpachi a little overs 5 year ago.
Before that, the closest thing I had played were the likes of Xevious, Truxton and Thunder Force.
For years I thought the shooting genre was just dead, then someone showed me MAME and I discovered shooters were not only alive and well, they were way better now,
I didn't like emulating though, so I got into the import scene, getting a sega saturn, dreamcast, etc and imported my favourite titles.
Cave made many of those favourites

When I logged into Steam one day and saw "mushihimesama now available" I just about pissed my pants with excitement.
This is a title by one of my favourite devs, I hadn't played it before coming to steam, but I bought it as soon as I saw it.
The chance to support a developper like Cave and show them that there IS western interest in their games was something I jumped at.

Now in this game, you play as Reco, a cute girl who rides on a beetle through the forests.
You'll notice that the art style has a lot in common with Nausicaa Valley of the Wind, and that is a very good thing!
The sprites are beautiful and the whole game has great attention to detail.
That beautiful art combined with the amazing, (but sometimes downright evil) bullet patterns creates a great sense of awe.

The gameplay is pretty typical of the genre, you must blast and weave your way through wave after wave of enemies, then take down a boss.
It has 5 action packed stages and a secret boss if you can get to it.
Your hitbox is tiny, and the bullets plentiful, thousands onscreen at once.
I won't go too in depth about the game modes, but you get about 7 different ways to play, accomodating everyone from the beginner to the expert.
Novice original is the most accessible game mode, thanks to it's inclusion, I highly reccomend this to anyone who would like to give this genre a chance but is afraid of the steep learning curve.
However, if you're a veteran of the genre, turn it up a bit and you'll find yourself with a white knuckled challenge that will keep you busy for ages.
As much as I love this genre I'm not actually very good at it, so I have thoroughly enjoyed working my way up, I'm yet to beat novice maniac but I have 1cc'd original mode, which is something I wanted to achieve before I even thought about a review.


Overall, this is the best shmup you can get on Steam right now, and I doubt that will change until Cave releases another game.
This is an absolute must have!

==ケイブからの声== (ケイブHPから抜粋)

◆from スタッフmさん
撃つ×倒す×かわす×進む＝爽快と言うシューティングゲームにおいて普遍的な部分をそのままずっと継承、追求していって欲しいなと思います。
シューティングゲームって何が楽しいのかと言う部分を大切に、その上で、個々のゲームシステムがどんどん昇華していけば、より楽しくなって行くのではないでしょうか。

◆from スタッフsさん
ゲーセンで遊んでいる時の、プレイヤーとギャラリーが一体になるような独特のあの空気感を、時代に則した新しい形態に昇華してほしい。
あの空気感を長らく牽引してきたシューティングというジャンルにしか成し得ない事だと思う。
今こそゲーセン文化の永久保存＆進化再生を！

◆from アプリエンジニア
でもさ、車のメーカーがスーパーカーから一度撤退して、数年後に復活することってあるでしょ。
売上にはあまりつながらないんだけど、ブランディング戦略として機能している。
ケイブにおける弾幕系シューティングも、そんな位置づけになっていけばいいなと思っていて。

◆from IKD (元東亜プラン、代表作:ヴイ・ファイヴ、BATSUGUN)
制作している側としては、敵の配置や攻撃はすべてリズムです。
プレイ初期のころは受動的にプレイするので、ここでいかにノレて（ノセられて）気持ちよくなれなるか？そして、ゲームを理解して徐々に能動的にプレイし始めたときに、いかに熱いか？リスクを伴った分だけのリターンを段階的に伝え、より熱いシチュエーションに導いてこそケイブシューティングだと思います。

シューティングゲームはジャンル的にマス向けではなく、ビジネスとしてのハードルは高いのかもしれません。
でも、トレンドとうまくミックスさせていけば、「こういう形にケイブは落とし込むんだ」という驚きを与えていくことができる。
コアユーザー以外にも刺さるようなアプローチで仕上げることは、充分に可能だと思っています。
ケイブの歴史を振り返ると、業績的に大きくジャンプアップしたとき、シューティングゲームが貢献していたという前例は少ないんですよ。
だから、次に会社をもう1ランク上に持っていくときには、シューティングゲームで貢献したい。そこを担うのは、私の使命だと思っています。

◆from 社長 (元東亜プラン、代表作:究極タイガー)
アーケード、コンシューマー、オンライン、ソーシャルといったように、私たちケイブはゲーム業界の変遷に合わせてソフトを生み出し続けています。
どんなプラットフォームであるかは表面的な要素であって、言ってみればアウトプットはどこでもいいんです。



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=abuWKfyj-bM



※2016/3 Caveスタッフインタビュー
当社の社長自身は「アーケードスティックでゴ魔乙やりたいんだよな」と言っています。
以前も，半ば冗談ですが「ゲーセン1軒作るといくら？」って聞いてました。
軽い気持ちでも言われた以上は調べないといけないので，いちおう「秋葉原の路面で2階建てで，ワンフロアに15台置けますので，月々の賃料や内装費を考えると初期費用は1000万円くらいでしょう」という調査結果を出しました。
冗談か本気か分からないですが，社長は「週に2，3日くらい池田をガラス張りのところで開発させれば人が来るんじゃない？」って言ってましたよ。
矢川がSTGの基板を150枚くらい持っているんですよ。もし本当にゲーセンを作るなら，彼とレンタル契約を結ぼうかとも思ってました。

19350191.review:
Well, this is a bullet hell -game very much by the book, and so, if you like or hate thing x you pretty much hate or like the entire genre. However, while I respect the genre, I cannot praise it blindly either...

First off, you can see every stage, every pattern, every mode etc. in less than 2 hours. Of course, mastering the stages is hardly the same as seeing them, but chances are you'll grow bored if you lack the perfectionism required.

While the visuals are high quality and the artwork follows a personal style too, the bosses are very much bug a, bug b and so on, I get that its in the title, but it feels like the transitions are noticeably few too, compared to say, Touhou...

Last but certainly not least, the archaic 'continue' -mechanic. Seriously, this is a feature from a time when arcade machines were designed to empty wallets, it has no place in PC games. But no, the game feels the need to actively pause the affair and make the player feel bad about themselves before lending them a chance to continue from the exact same spot, everything forgiven, as if (imaginary) money was indeed the magic bullet and solution to all problems. How hard would it be to implement stage resets upon continue, or better yet, boss stage resets? This way I could at least feel I've been given a genuine right to proceed after beating the boss, that I'd have overcome some sort of a wall on my own, rather than just admitting that I sucked.

19298020.review:
Mushihimesama is an arcade classic Shmup (Shoot'em up) from 2004 by Cave Interactive, a studio well known for their bullet hell games.

Mushihimesama seem to live up to Cave Interactive's reputation, as it features some of the most bullet's I've seen on a a screen at once. Reflex based gameplay is the highlight here and your skill as a shump player will absolutely be tested. Having so much bullets on the screen the developers have done something very smart, and only a master of the genre could come up with. Make the character's hitbox smaller than the character model itself. The hit box is only about the size of the character's head. You may say "but that doesn't make sense, and would only confuse the player", but the reality is, in a good shmup, the player never looks directly at the character itself. Rather, the player will use his/her peripheral vision to track the character while paying attention to on coming dangers, almost like using a sixth scent. By designing the hitbox this way, it allows the peripheral vision to easily follow the character, while "feeling" their way around the bullets. It's simply brilliant and intuitive design on the part of the developers.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ksqFN9xVap4
Aside from the hitbox design, the bullets are large, flashy, and purple and clear. There are no other purple elements in the game besides the bullets, which also adds to the excellent visual clarity of the game. The bullet's formations are also unique to Mushihimesama, beautiful at times, and most importantly, challenging and satisfying to bob and weave around.

While playing you'll also be be able to collect upgrades and bombs. Upgrades are pretty obvious, as they'll upgrade your offensive capabilities, but bombs are the real strategic element of the game. Not only incredibly powerful, but they'll also whip the screen of any on coming bullets, giving the player a short opportunity to breath, or to escape an unavoidable situation. Use the bombs sparingly and strategically and you'll rack up those point chains in no time

The game also features great music, audio, and for a 2004 game, it stands the test of time as far as visuals and presentation are concerned. Distinctly Japanese, and it's wonderful.

Mushihimesama also features multiple modes to play, from time attack, novice mode, and even arranged mode. Though they all play fairly similar, does offer enough variability for people who are really into the meta of the game to find intriguing and worth exploring.

So I've said plenty of praise for the game, and in my opinion, it deserves all of it, but what about the negatives? No game is perfect after all. Mushihimesama can be unstable at times. When it was originally launched, many people, including myself reported a crash on load. Luckily that's been patched out (mostly). I still experience crashes when I alt tab sometimes, but, they are very rare. The game also slows down when a lot of stuff is going on, and this is persistent no matter how amazing your PC is. The game can also be repetitive as well, since even with all the different game modes available it is the same content over and over again. You can finish the game first time through in about 20 minutes. Since the game is an arcade port, and in the arcade, the main punishment for failure is more quarters, that element doesn't translate as well when it's on PC. To be fair, Shumps are rarely about completing the game, and are made to be replayed. It's the points that matter when you're talking about the high end, and when you continue, it does reset your score to a degree. In the context of the genre, this is still a reasonable punishment for the player, though even with that said, does lose some of it's punch as a port outside of the arcade.

Overall Mushihimesama is a fantastic shmup and if you're a fan of the genre, I have no hesitation to recommend it. If you are a more casual gamer, who's simply curious to the game, $20 might be perceived as high for a lot of recycled content, but even with that said, that content is about as solid of a shmup can ever hope to achieve. 

Pros:
- Brilliant design on the character, the hitbox, and the bullets themselves
- Satisfying and at time gorgeous bullet patterns
- A fair amount of side content for the player to explore
- Hardcore shmup fans should have no problem falling in love with Mushihimesama

Cons:
- A lot of recycled content
- Can be repetitive for more casual players
- Some technical limitations

Mushihimesama played: 4
Completion Status on Mushihimesama: Completed
This copy of The Mushihimesama was given by the developer

From the relaxed pace of Novice Original to the screen-filling nightmare that is Arcade Ultra, you're guaranteed to find a difficulty you can handle - and from there, you can gradually work your way up.

19217666.review:
The SHMUP or STG genre as a whole is by far one of the most niche genre in video gaming today.
Today you really only read about either Cave or Touhou if you follow the STG scene.

Mushihimesama is one of Cave's finest, catering towards both a new generation of players & bringing extreme brutality to experienced bullet hell players. Replay value mostly comes from the leaderboards they've introduced, as well as just getting better at the game period. 

Cave took a massive risk in bringing Mushihimesama here as opposed to something that's more known in the west (like DoDonPachi). Was the risk worth it? Who's to say for certain, I don't have the sales figures here. HOWEVER I do own the game now and the elusive and super rare Matsuri (the ver1.5 DLC) version on steam. 

This game is a YES BUY IT.
If you're a huge fan of anything SHMUPS buy it now!
If you're not big onto SHMUPS but you enjoy quality games, you could wait for sales.

19138656.review:
>>>This review has been written after 10 hours of play time<<<

So let's get going...

Mushihimesama is one of the best vertical scrolling shmups currently available on steam. It features 5 entirely different levels, each one set up in a unique and compelling way. These levels can be played on varying difficulty settings with three different "ship" types and different modes to add even more variety and depth. 

The beginner friendly novice difficulty, as well as the normal difficulty, is separated into 3 different modes, with unique scoring systems and their own challenges in regards to scoring and staying alive.

Don't let the art style fool you, this not some kiddy/girly game throwing monkey wrenches at you, this is a bullet hell game with all the bells and whistles, frenetic, engaging and satisfying all throughout. Well planned and designed bullet patterns will fill your screen like nobody's business, especially when going for more difficult modes. The encounters are nicely orchestrated and structured. The stages play and feel different every time you approach them in a different way, be it hunting for scores or just trying another "ship" type.

Replayable? Definitely... If you are the type of player to sink your teeth into games to improve on scores, routes, or to simply push yourself. If you are simply looking for some fireworks, you can have those in spades, but you might be missing out on some of the fun, challenges and content, for that matter. This game is no fast food at all. The more you practice, the further you will go, the higher your final score will be. This game respects your time and rewards you for your efforts.

Sure, the art style is matter of taste, but it is somewhat refreshing to have it this way, because the number of military-styled shmups is legion. The colours are vibrant, there is effort put into details which you might easily miss in the heat of the battle. The soundtrack is moody, catchy and matches the overall visual theme, which is always appreciated. The way it looks and sounds, it works fine, simple as that.

Is it worth the money? This is something you will have to answer for yourself, because my 20 bucks are not your 20 bucks, if you know what I'm saying. Should you like shmups in general it is worth your time and money, should Mushihimesama be on sale at some point, doubly so. If the idea of thousands of bullets flying around makes your fingertips tingle: What are you waiting for?

Mushihimesama is a Japanese vertical scrolling shooter focused on bugs. Like, insects. The game-bugs were pretty much all fixed within the first week of its release thanks to Degica and Cave, who have shown outstanding support for the game, paying attention to enthusiast forums following release to guage the reactions of the hardcore fans. They took comments and criticisms from these boards very seriously and took them into account for each update, providing a better and better experience every time with one notable exception, but even then that issue was corrected with another patch not even a day later.

The gameplay itself is tight and focused with a mode suited to someone of any skill level. Highly recommended!

19072040.review:
弾幕シューティング制作で有名なCAVEがsteamに参戦。
その記念すべき第一弾がこの虫姫さまだ。
アーケード稼働が2004年なので約11年前の作品である。
良作は何年経っても色あせることがない。

さてこの虫姫さまだが、ゲームシステム的にはオーソドックスな弾幕STGといえる。
敵が出たら撃つ、弾がきたら避ける、やばくなったら即ボムる。
基本的にはこれだけでよく、複雑なシステムは搭載されていない。
弾幕STG経験者なら何の問題もないだろうし、初心者であってもすぐに慣れることができるだろう。

ゲームモードはオリジナルモード、マニッアックモード、ウルトラモードの三つが用意されている。
それぞれ特徴が異なり簡単に説明すると、オリジナルは弾幕が薄い代わりにやや弾速が速い、マニアックは従来の弾幕モード、ウルトラは廃人向けのモードといった感じだ。
難易度的にはオリジナルとマニアックはそれほど差はないが、ウルトラだけは別格の難しさで、常人がちょっと練習してどうこうというレベルではないのでそこは注意すべし。
特にウルトラのラスボスであるアキ＆アッカは別次元の強さであり、本当にノーコンクリアできるのか疑ってしまうレベル。
腕に自信がある人はぜひ挑戦してみてほしい。君ならできるよ(笑)。

と、まあウルトラモードはぶっ飛んだ難易度なのだが、一方できちんと初心者向けの配慮もされている。
それがノービスモードの存在だ。
このノービスモードは、通常のノーマルモードに比べると弾速弾幕ともにだいぶマイルドであり、初心者向けのモードといって差し支えない。
弾幕STGが苦手な人はまずこちらから始めてみるといいだろう。

細かな不満点としては、解像度が変更できない、ノービスモードのトレーニングが存在しない、ギャラリーモードがないなどの点が挙げられるが、それらを除けば全体的に手堅くまとまっており、弾幕シューティング入門としてもおすすめできる作品です。

19060159.review:
If you don't know of CAVE, chances are you've never played a shootemup before. Fun scoring systems, well designed stages, bullet patterns and bosses, as well as good graphics for its genre to boot. 

The game offers Novice, Normal and Arrange off the bat, and offers 1.5 as a DLC you can purchase. Novice. Normal and 1.5 each have Original, Maniac, and Ultra for difficulty options, while Arrange only has a single difficulty, but is unique in its scoring and difficulty from the others available modes. There is a ton of replayability in this game, even for highly skilled shootemup players. Ultra is incredibly brutal without even considering the true last boss.

Highly recommend this to anyone looking to get into the genre as this is easily some of the best the genre has to offer.

19028089.review:
One of my all time favorite Bullet-Hell/Shoot 'em up games ever is finally on Steam.

The fun of this game comes not only from how well crafted the graphics, sound, bullet patterns, enemy types, etc all are, but also from how simple but elegant the scoring systems are. If you keep playing you WILL keep getting better, and you WILL keep getting higher scores. The game has multiple game modes, each with their own quirks, scoring systems, and differing mechanics. Not only do you have Arcade mode, but you also have Novice mode and Arrange mode. And then each of those has Original, Maniac, and Ultra modes, which differ in more ways than just difficulty.

There's also guaranteed to be unlimited challenge as far as the difficulty is concerned. Novice Original is easy enough that people who've never picked up a game like this can 1 credit clear, while Novice Ultra provides for a great time for new players but still has that "holy crap I can't believe I just survived that" feel to it. Then on the other end of the spectrum is Arcade Ultra, which is damned near impossible, you have unlimited credits which is an awesome feature but the challenge of course is to finish each mode with no credits or as less credits as possible and set a new high score.

+ Great and varied modes and difficulty settings to suit your skill level
+ Great Soundtrack
+ Infinite continues
+ Graphics and art style

P.S. the game at launch had a few problems like crashing and not running at all for some like me but now its fixed and runs fine.

18997782.review:
I couldn't believe it when I saw it, a CAVE shmup on steam, like a dream come true. Personal aweing aside..

The game is a great pickup for fans of bullet hell shmups, that is to say if you are a fan of Dodonpachi, Touhou and the like. You may have seen this game released as "Bug Princess" on iOS, this is that game.

If you aren't familiar with the genre, then the game has modes of play that help you settle in nicely, that being the novice modes, you can go at a leisurely pace that ramps up the difficulty at a rate that'll get you used to things. Keyboard and controller are all well supported for the game thankfully, so arcade stick fans can enjoy themselves too. Lovely music, including new original mixes and the graphics are nice and crisp. So far it's looking like a nice port.

For big shmup players who already know the game, 2 words, Steam Leaderboards.

Pick it up if you want to try this genre now it's on this platform!

18990533.review:
※私はＳＴＧ含め、どのゲームでも基本ヘタレであり
　どんなゲームでも一番簡単なモードで楽しもうとするようなプレイヤーです。

システム面の不具合などについては他の方もレビューされていますので割愛します。

元々弾幕系のＳＴＧには苦手意識があり、ゲーセンで稼働していた頃もやったことはなかったのですが、手頃な値段で購入出来るならと、始めてみました。

このゲームには３つ（1.5版を購入すると4つ）のモード
Novice,Normal,Arrange,（1.5版）が選べ、
更にそれぞれのモードで３つの難易度（オリジナル，マニアック，ウルトラ）が選択できます。

Noviceは初心者向けのモード

Normalは文字通りノーマル（基準）となるモード

Arrangeは最初からフル装備で、オートボム機能搭載（敵の弾に当たるとボムを全て消費してボムを発動。ミスを回避してくれる）、どこでもショットの切り替えが出来る、コンティニュー不可、ＢＧＭの変更といったアレンジが加えられたモード

1.5は「MAXセレクトシステム」という、最初からフル装備になりArrangeと同じオートボム機能も装備されるけど敵が強くなる、という独自のシステムを選択することが可能になっています。またＢＧＭもアレンジ版になっています。

またNormalと1.5はそれぞれ下記の難易度とは別に、ゲームオプション内で4段階の難易度が設定されています（デフォルトは2）。

（ゲーム開始時に選択できる）難易度はちょっと複雑で、
オリジナルは基本となる難易度
マニアックはオリジナルと比べ敵の弾が遅くなる代わりに、弾数が増える（弾幕になる）
ウルトラは上級者向けで全体的に難しくなっている上、ラスボスを倒した直後に真ボスが登場します。

上記の通り、モードや難易度は様々な組み合わせが可能なので、自分好みに調整可能。私のようなヘタレプレイヤーや初心者でも楽しめますし、ＳＴＧ上級者でも充分楽しめます……まあＳＴＧ上級者なら、既に虫姫さまはプレイ済みか、あるいは評判をどこかしらで聞いているでしょうから、こんなヘタレレビューをこんな所まで読んではいないでしょうけれどもｗ

さて、ここからレビューとなるわけですが……
私は「Normalでオリジナル」「Noviceでオリジナル」「Noviceでマニアック」という順番で、コンティニュー駆使してクリアしました。
やってみた感想としては……ヘタレプレイヤーでも「Noviceでオリジナル」ならノーコンティニューが狙えるかも？ という感触を得られたので、このモードと難易度で挑戦していこうかな、という気になっております。
ヘタレ故にNoviceオリジナルでもヒヤヒヤしながら弾を避けてましたが、ヘタレにはほどよい攻撃。弾幕ＳＴＧをプレイしている……という感じではないですが、元々シンプルなＳＴＧなので、私にはこれで充分でした。
マニアックはNoviceでもシッカリ弾幕張ってきますので、弾幕ＳＴＧがやりたいんだという人にはこちらをお勧め。ただ、マニアックは弾が遅くなるということでしたが、各面のボス以外、弾幕が遅くなった印象は正直ありませんでした。なので途中の雑魚戦が辛かった印象。人によってはオリジナルよりマニアックの方が簡単に感じるらしいのですが、私にとってはオリジナルの方が楽でした。

私の感触としては、
オリジナル＝普通のＳＴＧ
マニアック＝弾幕ＳＴＧ
といった感じで、ウルトラはまだやってないので何とも言えないのですが……まあコンティニューが無限で、その場復活ですから、いずれは挑戦してみようかなと思っております。

全5面。1プレイだいたい30分前後でクリア出来ますので、スマホゲーほど気軽ではないにしても手軽にプレイ出来るのもこのゲームの魅力でしょうか。

あー、あと個人的に気になったのはヒロインのセリフが棒（以下略）

追記

このゲームには「ショット」「ボム」「フルオート」の他に、「ショットチェンジ」「ラピッドショット」「ラピッドフルオート」というボタンが設定されています。

ショットチェンジはArrangeでのみ使用するボタンです。

このゲーム、ショットでもフルオートでも押しっぱなしにすれば連射してくれ、オプションも攻撃してくれるのですが、
ショットボタンを押しっぱなしにすると、自機のスピードが遅くなり自機当たり判定の範囲が表示されるようになります（弾を細かく避けるのに必要）。
フルオートは自機のスピードをそのままに、連射とオプションの攻撃を行ってくれます。
これに対して、各ラピッドは連射してくれる上に、ゲームオプションで細かく連射の間隔を調整することが可能。ただし、オプションは攻撃してくれなくなります（オプションはボタンを押しっぱなしにしないと攻撃しない→ラピッド（連射）だとオプションは攻撃しない、という事）
初心者には判りづらいボタン設定なのですが、上級者はスコア稼ぎのためにボタンを使い分ける必要があるそうなので、そこは割り切って、とりあえずフルオートボタン押しっぱなしで良いと思います。
私はボタンの意味をちゃんと理解しないまま、連射してくれるボタンがいいんだろうとラピッドフルオートでゲームをプレイしていて、オプションが機能してくれないまま苦戦していましたｗ
